title: Improve career roadmap quality and add an ATS-friendly Resume Generator tool

requirements.text:
Improve the deterministic career roadmap content so the generated roadmaps are more realistic, career-relevant, and free of irrelevant or misleading technology references.

Specifically update the roadmap template data used by `getRoadmapTemplate(...)` so that:
- Roadmaps do not mention unsupported stack/deployment items (e.g., AWS/Vercel, MongoDB, Node/Express) as required steps unless they are clearly optional and career-appropriate.
- Learning phases, topics, and resources are tailored to the selected career (or at least to its category) and remain consistent with Indian student/fresher context.
- The roadmap output remains fully deterministic (no external API/AI calls) and continues to render via the existing Roadmap UI components without breaking layout.
acceptanceCriteria: For multiple sampled careers across different categories (e.g., Frontend Developer, Data Analyst, Cybersecurity Analyst, UI Designer), the generated phases/topics/resources are career-appropriate and not generic filler.
Roadmaps no longer include obviously mismatched requirements like AWS/Vercel deployment or MongoDB/Node as mandatory steps for every technology career category.
No external calls are added; roadmap generation remains deterministic and purely local.
Existing roadmap pages/sections (homepage section and /career-roadmap-generator) continue to function and render without runtime errors.

requirements.text:
Add a new ATS-friendly Resume Generator tool as a dedicated tool page/route.

The tool must:
- Be a step-by-step wizard (not a single long form) covering key resume sections: Contact, Summary, Skills (hard + soft), Experience (with action-verb and metrics prompts), Education, Certifications, Projects, and Keywords.
- Generate a clean, ATS-friendly, single-column resume output preview from the collected inputs.
- Provide export options: (1) copy the full resume as plain text to clipboard and (2) download the resume as a .txt file.
- Use clear English for all labels, helper text, and outputs.

quotes: add make real are good ATS resume.

acceptanceCriteria: A new dedicated route exists for the ATS Resume Generator and loads successfully without blank/white-screen issues.
The UI is a multi-step wizard with next/back navigation and clearly separated sections (Contact, Summary, Skills, Experience, Education, Certifications, Projects, Keywords).
The tool produces a single-column ATS-friendly preview (no tables, no multi-column formatting in the generated output).
Users can copy the full resume output as plain text to clipboard successfully.
Users can download the resume as a .txt file containing the same content as the preview/output.

requirements.text:
Integrate the new ATS Resume Generator into the existing navigation entry points for resume tools.

Add a new tool card in the existing "Resume & Placement Help" section that navigates to the new ATS Resume Generator dedicated page/route (do not open it in the existing modal), while keeping the existing four resume tool cards unchanged and still modal-based.

quotes: add make real are good ATS resume.

acceptanceCriteria: The Resume & Placement Help section shows an additional tool card for the ATS Resume Generator.
Clicking the new card navigates to the dedicated ATS Resume Generator route (full page), not a modal.
The existing four tools (Resume Bullet Generator, Internship Email Template, Interview Prep Checklist, LinkedIn Profile Checklist) still open in the modal and behave as before.

requirements.text:
Add SEO + routing configuration for the ATS Resume Generator page so it participates in the existing SEO system and technical SEO assets.

Update:
- TanStack Router to register the new page route (lazy-loaded like other tool pages).
- `frontend/src/seo/seoRoutes.ts` to include metadata (title, description, keywords, canonicalPath) for the new route.
- `frontend/public/sitemap.xml` to include the new URL so it is discoverable by search engines.

Ensure user-facing SEO strings are in clear English.

quotes: add make real are good ATS resume.

acceptanceCriteria: The ATS Resume Generator route is registered in the router and is code-split/lazy-loaded similar to other tool routes.
`seoRoutes` contains an entry for the new ATS Resume Generator path with title/description/keywords/canonicalPath.
`sitemap.xml` includes the new ATS Resume Generator URL entry.
The new page renders HeadTags + StructuredData the same way other tool pages do (no layout impact).

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not add or require any login/authentication flows (including Internet Identity) anywhere in the UI.
All roadmap and resume generation must be deterministic and run locally in the browser (no external AI/API calls).
Preserve the existing design system (Tailwind + shadcn components, card styling, spacing) and avoid disruptive layout changes.
Backend remains a minimal single-actor Motoko canister; do not introduce backend dependencies for these features.
nonGoals: Do not implement PDF/DOCX export for the ATS resume (TXT + clipboard only).
Do not add third-party resume parsing/scoring/ATS-checker integrations.
Do not redesign unrelated homepage sections or existing tools beyond what is needed to add the new tool card and improve roadmap content.
